observation: I can see a country selection page with a dropdown list showing many countries. The dropdown appears to be open and I can see countries like Afghanistan, Aland Islands, Albania, etc. listed with their flag emojis. There's also a 'Next' button at the bottom that appears to be the main call-to-action for proceeding once a country is selected. I notice Australia is visible in the list (element 71) which would be a good choice for an elderly user as it's a familiar country without restrictions.
reasoning: As a 70-year-old user, I need to select a country from this long list. Australia is a safe, recognizable choice that should be allowed on most platforms. I can see it clearly in the list at element 71. Selecting Australia will help me proceed with the sign-up process.
ux_issues: The country list is very long and may be overwhelming for elderly users
Small text size in the country list may be hard to read
No clear indication of which countries might be restricted

outcome.visual_observation: The dropdown menu remains closed and the placeholder text 'Select' is still visible. No country selection appears to have been made and the interface has not progressed in the sign-up flow.
outcome.diagnosis: The tap action on the Australia country option did not register or execute properly. The dropdown either didn't open to show country options or the Australia selection was not processed.
